Reviews.Title: “Good place in west Indy”
Reviews.Author: bigdog575_75
Reviews.Content: Liked the biscuits and gravy at breakfast. Shower was big, great location off 465 and near 74 on west side. Would stay again if traveling up north again

Reviews.Title: “Average Sleep Inn”
Reviews.Author: syamaha022
Reviews.Content: Was in town for the Supercross race at Lucas Oil Stadium. The hotel was outdated, but it was very clean and reasonable for price paid during the event. If wanting to use a pool, you have to walk across the lot to the adjacent Comfort Inn, which is not ideal during the winter. The staff was very friendly, same lady working when check-in at around 4pm and check-out around 11am. Only complaint was the parking, with the hotel sharing a parking lot with the Comfort Inn. No spots were open in the general parking, so we parked in the park and fly area, even though we did not have a tag. GPS didnt find the correct exit number but that wasnt a problem since we know our way around Indianapolis somewhat, even though getting to hotel once off interstate is somewhat confusing. Overall it is a slight above average hotel and an average Sleep Inn. Would recommend but as for us, we will be staying closer to Lucas Oil Stadium this year.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for @ cheapest hotel in area”
Reviews.Author: IMJetlagged
Reviews.Content: Quite clean for a cheap and moderately worn hotel. The staff were very sweet so it was sad to learn the business is in receivership. The room amenities are standard, coffee maker, iron, tv, hairdryer etc. No tub. Bed was so-so but pillows were softer than a lot of hotels in pricier chains. Window air conditioning is noisy, so at least I didn't hear the interstate. Blah view of Sam's Club parking lot. They no longer offer microwaves or refrigerators in rooms or a shuttle service ... inc. airport transfers!!! (not good for an "airport hotel"). Basic TV channels. On the upside the free wi-fi worked well. Did I mention it was clean(?!), I was surprised. There is a complimentary continental breakfast - which from industry standard experience I decided to sleep through. However, this is NOT a safe area of Indiana. This hotel would work if you need a quick and very cheap place to stay (@$50+/- night) but there are not a lot of food options (unless you have a Sams club membership). I feel bad for this hotel operation without an airport shuttle service; being in such a bad area leaving the hotel or parking a vehicle in the vicinity seems too high a risk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheClarks2011
Reviews.Content: affordable, clean, quiet, friendly staff w/ quick check in and easy check out

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Sleep Inn, but not the best in the chain.”
Reviews.Author: jjctraveler
Reviews.Content: Checkin was fast with a very helpful young man. My third floor room was spacious and nice. The internet worked great. But then I kept finding little things wrong. The TV only has about a 19 channels with the main networks and ESPN. There was no chain lock on the door. Breakfast was very limited with toast, fruit and cereal, no waffles. The AC in the rooms worked great, but the hallways were very hot. The beds were good and I slept well, so that was nice. The bathroom is typical Sleep in configuration with a sink and very small counter area and seperate shower/toilet. The hotel is next to a Sam’s and several other hotels, with eating establishments nearby. Easy access to the interestate, but motel was still quiet. They have a park N Fly program, but a separate parking lot for them which frees up the spots right in front of the hotel for guests, which is really great. (Great idea!) I paid $50 + 17% tax, and the tax is outrageous for a city the size of Indianapolis. I am not sure I would stay here again. In general, when visiting Indianapolis, I try to stay outside the city due to the high taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport location!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoIlLilly
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this Sleep Inn on many occasions when we fly from the Indianapolis airport. It is a basic hotel but is extremely clean and the staff is excellent. They have a park and stay rate that is a bargain too. It's a safe location for you and your auto. They offer a basic continental breakfast with the addition of a few cold cereals but considering the bargain price of your room rate it's an added plus. The staff is extremely helpful. There are nearby restaurants too that are walkable. They include a bar-grill and a Mexican sitdown one. There's fast food too nearby. It is also next door to a Sam's club and if you're a member of Sam's club you can get pizza slices, hotdogs, sandwiches or salads to take back to your room or a book to read during your flight. IThey offer free 24 hour shuttle service to the airport too and the shuttle service is also excellent. In fact we have always been very impressed with the quick shuttle service even during later night hours. This is just an excellent bargain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: haydenrun
Reviews.Content: On way back from Minneapolis to Columbus, Ohio. Had stayed at a Sleep Inn in Madison on way to Minneapolis, and was pleased with the experience. This hotel did not change my opinion. Good comfortable room, pleasant and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Another great experience at Sleep inn”
Reviews.Author: catonsville
Reviews.Content: What a nice motel! I stayed here for the second year to attend the Indy 500. Nice,curteous staff, clean rooms, convienent to the interstate ( I drove). This motel is a partner to the Comfort Inn just across the parking lot. Guests at the Sleep Inn have privileges at the Comfot Inn for use of the swimming pool, and laundry facilities. The check in was quick and the clerks were helpful, and kind. The obviously love thier job. It shows as well. The motel is only a couple of miles from the speedway, with a shuttle provided to and from the speedway on the Friday- Saturday- Sunday of the race weekend. Thr rooms are clean and spacious. As i posted last year after my first stay here, you can't have my room for next years race....I re-booked it. Sleep Inn is that good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Promt”
Reviews.Author: dfbf3131
Reviews.Content: We did the Stay/Park?Fly Very Good deal was on time. One call after we claimed baggage was out side waiting on us . Nice quiet room not much of conn. breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Don't think I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: blacktail01
Reviews.Content: I am very picky about clean rooms, bathrooms and noise. The room was pretty clean but the bathroom was strange! It only had a pocket door and weird shower that extends into the room. The room was also very loud, in addition to hearing every conversation in the hall loud and clear there was also a thumping noice the entire night.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bigwave1010
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was very nice and accommodating when we checked in. I have a thing about bathrooms. If they are dirty, I can't see past that. The shower door track was filthy and had a hole that had rusty through. The rest of the roon was ok. We didn't receive our free pizza coupon which was no big deal because we had eaten dinner a little earlier. In the morning, I read that we would receive a complimentary breakfast. If you had to leave before 6am, then you would receive some type of breakfast that you could take with you. I asked about breakfast and was told that it didn't start until 6am - sorry. We had to leave at 5:45. The shuttle to the airport was great - on time, perfect. Gettting picked up after our trip was another story. We waited for an hour to get picked up along with a party of 9. They had been waiting 10 -15 minutes longer than us. We were told that the shuttle broke down and they had to get another one. The party of 9 said that was what happened last time they stayed at this hotel. In the parking lot of this hotel is a Comfort Inn and Wyndham. The Wyndham looked brand new and, if I remember correctly, it was around the same price. Next time, I will book the Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back, I enjoyed it.”
Reviews.Author: HandsumMuscle
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Sleep Inn. My room was big and clean and the breakfast was well stocked. Jenny at the front desk was super friendly and accomodating. I'll for sure be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Motel but. .”
Reviews.Author: DougR55
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean motel. Great staff at the front desk who was very helpful. The rooms were cleaned and very nice when arrived. The only thing this room needs is a BIGGER television. The small TV that sits on the desk in front of the couch is poor quality and has a very small screen. If you are into sports at all and are watching ESPN, you will have to sit on the edge of the foot of the bed to see the score and the time clock. Also the picture quality is less than ideal. It tends to be too dark. The remote works good though. For the size of this room it makes sense to have at least a 32" TV. The internet worked great. The free pizza is not free. Mine was going to cost me $5.40. Parking is also an issue. The lot is filled with cars and trucks, but they are people who are using it as long term parking instead of paying the airport fees. So motel customers have to park in the adjoining Sams Club parking lot .

Reviews.Title: “REFRESHING”
Reviews.Author: bmurphy1980
Reviews.Content: My past couple of hotel stays haven't been so good. So I was surprised when I stayed at this hotel on Thanksgiving. The lady at the desk greeted me promptly and was very friendly. When I got to my room it was very clean. However I realized that I had booked 2 twins instead of a King. I explained the situation to her and she happily switched my rooms. The 3 days we were there she greeted me everytime I left and came back. It was refreshing to have such a friendly staff at that hotel it really made my stay there far better.

Reviews.Title: “nice room at great price”
Reviews.Author: leavingitallbehind
Reviews.Content: our room with a king sized bed was comfortable & just the right size for 2 people. the newly renovated motel was clean and looked nice. the staff was pleasant. we always turn the fan on in our room to reduce noise & this worked wonderfully-we weren't disturbed by any other guests. the breakfast was what we expected-the usual cereal, bagels, muffins, yogurt, fruits that you would expect for travelers. although I didn't use it, they had a computer available for use. we got our money's worth in comparison to motel that charge twice as much for what we got here.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay if you fly in to go to races”
Reviews.Author: trevor-wa
Reviews.Content: I flew in from Seattle to attend the GP motorcycle races. The Sleep Inn and the sister hotel , the Comfort Suites share the same parking lot and management. They are very well managed and great shuttle service to and from the airport and the race track. I had now need to rent a car and cabs to take me to downtown and the dirt track race at the fairgrounds arrived within minutes of the hotel calling them.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the stay. Reccomend it to anyone”
Reviews.Author: catonsville
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from the 27th thru the 31st. I was in town for the Indy 500. Great room, and a polite, friendly staff. One of the desk clerks even loaned me her discount card for a local eatery, Grindstone Charleys. There was a shuttle to and from the track on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. The track is only 2.8 miles form the motel, about as close as you're going to find in that area ( believe me as I know. I did a thourough search of local accomodations). The motel is catty corner to a Comfort Inn, and Sleep Inn guests have privileges at the indoor pool over at Comfort Inn. Nice pool too!!!! The night before the 500 both motels have a cookout for guests. Complimentary drinks as well. The motel evidently does quite a business with guests making use of nearby Indianapolis Airport. The motel has a multi-day parking lot seperate from the regular parking lot that is under surveillance 24 hours a day that seems to be just for long term travelers using the airport ( see other posts here for more information about that). If you are planning on staying here in May 2011 for the Indy 500, you can't have my room. I have already made reservations for that room next year. Can't think of a better endorsement than that.

Reviews.Title: “A confirmed reservation means nothing; bait-and-switch”
Reviews.Author: Indyfanforever
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Indy 500. In January, I made online reservations for 2 nights on race weekend (May) and got a confirmation number. In April, I decided to add a third day and called the motel directly to get the best rate. First, I double-checked to make sure that they had me down for 2 days already, and the person I talked to said yes. Then she told me to go back online for the best rate for the extra night. I did, and I got a confirmation number. When we got to the motel around 5 pm on May 29, the front-desk person asked for my reservation/confirmation papers. She looked something up and told me there was a problem with the room and that we were being sent to Days Inn, "about 5 miles away. " I had chosen Sleep Inn because it was supposedly within walking distance of the track, about 2 miles away. It turned out that it was actually more like 3 miles. I asked why there was no room, when I had a made the reservation in January, and I was told "I don't know." She also said that it wasn't her fault, she didn't do it, I shoudn't be taking it out on her. I told her I wasn't taking it out on her and asked for a manager, since she claimed it wasn't her fault. She said she didn't know who the manager was because the motel had been bought out a month ago. We asked for directions to Days Inn. She marked a spot on a map and said she "thought" it was there. (Turned out the location she marked was incorrect.) My husband got the correct directions to Days Inn from the computer in the lobby, but couldn't get a printout. The computer spat out a blank piece of paper across the room. By this time, the front-desk person presumably had called someone and found out that the reason we didn't have a room was that the air conditioning was not working. I asked her when that happened. She said 2 days ago. I asked why no one called me. She said she didn't know, they should have called, don't take it out on her, "everyone" is blaming her, etc. (Another guest was also complaining about his room.) I cannot comment on the rooms at Sleep Inn because I never saw a room. We ended up at Days Inn (same owner). Days Inn was 7 miles from the track. Not exactly the "walking distance" I had reserved 4 months earlier. We would be charged Sleep Inn's rate to stay at Days Inn. I found out after the fact that Days Inn's rates were actually lower, yet we were being charged the higher rate for a room we never had. Little did we know that our problems would get even worse at Days Inn. . . . (Refer to review of Days Inn Airport Indianapolis) We were supposed to receive a phone call about all of this, but so far have gotten nothing.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Motel For A Budget Traveler”
Reviews.Author: margatemensch
Reviews.Content: This motel located on the periphery of Indianapolis was very good value for the money that I spent there.I stayed a full week with its special weekly rate,My room was quite nice,the free breakfast was quite good,and their staff was quite cordial.For visitors without cars,the #3 Indianapolis Bus Route runs close to this motel and takes you downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Park and Fly Deal is Great”
Reviews.Author: MizBinky
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November before a 6AM flight. The Park and Fly deal is fantastic and worth every single penny if you're going to be gone for a few days. Since my flight was so early, they gave me a bagged breakfast to take with me that had some mini blueberry muffins and a banana in it. The front desk staff was great both when I checked in late at night and in the early morning when I checked out. My only complaint and it's a nit picky thing is that the desk chair in my room had paint splattered all over it. Not sure what that was all about since everything else in the room looked relatively new and clean. I will definitely consider staying here again when flying out of Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Park and Fly package was a great deal”
Reviews.Author: couplenindy
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel when flying out of the Indianapolis Airport. The park and fly package was a great deal. We felt very comfortable leaving our car in this neighborhood while out of the country for a week. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was very polite. We had an early morning flight, so they packed us brown bag breakfasts to eat while we waited to check in for our flight at the airport. The free airport shuttle driver was friendly, and she was a safe driver. No frills, but perfect for what we needed. I would definatley stay here again if traveling out of the Indianapolis Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Average, Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: orlandoauction
Reviews.Content: Hotel undergoing a renovation right now. TV was ridiculously small. No fox news channel, and very few channels at all for that matter. Room was clean, carpet was new. Bed was clean and comfortable. Lobby is small, but staff was very nice and attentive. Interstate is under construction so using a GPS to get to the hotel is difficult. Not nearly enough electric outlets if you need many like I do. I would stay here again in the future. I paid business rate of 70 per night the Thursday before the Indy 500. Im happy with this sleep in, I've been to better and worse Sleep Inn's.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: rhedott
Reviews.Content: The front desk attendant was wonderful to my sister and I! We had a very long trip to Indianapolis and were exhausted when we arrived at the hotel. We don't know Indianapolis and weren't sure how to get around town. We thought this was not going to be a good trip. The front desk person had us to sit down and relax in the already closed breakfast area and poured us hot cups of coffee before we even unloaded our luggage from the car - which she even helped to unload! She gave us wonderful directions to everywhere we had to go in Indianapolis and told us if we had any questions or were the slightest bit confused by the road construction, to just give her call and she would be able to direct us around town. We felt like we were her only guests and were very well taken care of during our stay there. We have recommneded the hotel to family and friends and will definately be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Sleep Inn Airport West - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: cartoondogs2
Reviews.Content: We booked a flight that left Indianapolis early in the morning and returned a few days later at midnight. We used the sleep and fly package offered by the Sleep Inn Airport West.The room was very nice and we also got a free pizza from using this package. In the morning at 5:00 AM they took us to the airport, and when we returned at midnight they picked us up very quickly. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We had no problems with our car sitting there for 8 days. Thanks Sleep Inn Airport West

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to sleep and leave your car”
Reviews.Author: rwdw
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sleep Inn for their Park and Fly feature. We live in Illinois and are on Central time and were flying out of Indy at 7 am Eastern time. So we wanted to be able to sleep before we left for our flight. The rooms were clean. We turned the a/c on hight and noise from I-465 was not a problem. When we checked out, the van was waiting to take us to the airport. When we returned I called on the courtesy Phone at baggage pick up and the van was there in 10 minutes in heavy Friday night traffic. The van driver asked where we were parked in the lot and dropped us next to our car. We enjoyed our stay and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “A good overnight near Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: jtdriver
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here following a minor-league baseball game in Indianapolis. We went into the city first and approached from Rockville Road, and it was not obvious just where the motel was. But we saw it after doubling back. No problems checking in or with the room. Really, no complaints at all. The location was convenient and the price was right. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: bear1999
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean. Checkin was just OK. Bed was alright. Booked because they had a free airport shuttle and that part worked fine. In the room, no lamps just florescents in the ceiling over the head of the bed and only half worked. One bar of soap and no shampoo. The water was very hard so the shower and sink heads were clogged with minerals and did not work very well. The desk person has to handle breakfast and the front desk in the morning, so no coffee and frankly with lots of people checking out ---- no time to make coffee. On the chain web site this hotel won the chain's award for outstanding properties - so factor that in when choosing another Sleep Inn. This is my 2nd very disappointing stay at Clarion Properties and I will probably spend a little more for a better place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: RdWar1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel because I had an early morning flight. The rooms were clean with new, modern TVs and alarm clocks. They offered a "park and fly" option and an airport shuttle, and the rates were very reasonable. The only minor complaint is that it's so close to the highway, traffic noise could be heard all night. Try to ask for a "even-numbered" room with numbers 100-122, 200-222, or 300-322 to be on the side facing *away* from I465

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: familytripplanner
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night July 9th. Room was clean but the beds seemed small. Had a simple but good breakfast. Coffee was really good.

HotelInfo.Name: Sleep Inn Airport West
HotelInfo.Address: 5845 Rockville Road, Indianapolis, IN 46224
